Empire District Electric Co. had its first mortgage bonds and collateralized pollution-control revenue bonds upgraded to Ax from A, and its commercial paper upgraded to A1x from A1 by S.& P. The actions affect about $91 million.

title: ;  2 Panthers Down
description: The Michigan Panthers received a double dose of bad news when they learned that Anthony Carter , a wide receiver, had rebroken his left arm and that the cornerback Clarence Chapman had been suspended by Coach Jim Stanley for disciplinary reasons.

title: BROCKERAGE STOCK OUTLOOK
description: IT may come as small consolation to investors,

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Death Toll Nearing 200 In Indian Rioting
description: Hindus and Moslems fought with rocks, knives and firebombs here today and thousands of army troops moved into new areas to quell violence that has killed nearly 200 people.

title: Sow the Genetic Wind, Reap Delay
description: Genetic engineers have long set their sights on leap-frogging the patient methods of plant breeders and creating new crops by genetic manipulation in the laboratory. The first genetically modified plants and bacteria are finally ready to be ushered from laboratory to field, but last week an unexpected obstacle arose: Federal District Judge John Sirica ordered the Government to hold off approving any such experiments.

title: Reagan Choice Clears Hurdle
description: Senators supporting the Reagan Administration defeated an attempt today to sink the judgeship nomination of J. Harvie Wilkinson, a conservative law professor who has never tried a case in court.

title: REPORTER'S NOTEBOOK: A MAYAN POTTERY HUNT
description: Archeology, as someone once said, is a lot about pots - a maxim whose truth has been borne out here with the major discovery of an unlooted, painted Mayan tomb dating from the fifth century A.D.

title: MARATHON HOPEFUL IN FAST COMPANY
description: Though Nicolle Meyer will not become 3 years old until Tuesday, she knows what Daddy does.

title: NEW SCHOOL; 'A WISH FOR JUSTICE AND PEACE'
description: The president of the New School for Social Research urged graduates yesterday to find ''new approaches and new solutions to the quandaries facing us.''

title: RUTGERS UNIVERSITY; BLOUSTEIN SAYS STATE SCHOOLS ARE BECOMING MORE IMPORTANT
description: State universities such as Rutgers will increasingly become more important to the country's prosperity and security, the president of Rutgers told graduates today.

title: Bank-Role Legislation Introduced
description: Leaders of the House Banking Committee introduced legislation today to slow the trend toward interstate bank mergers and the blurring of lines dividing banks from other types of business. The legislation, if enacted, could also require dozens of companies to give up companies or banks they have merged with or bought.

title: TOURS FOR WALKERS IN THE CITY
description: AS spring arrives in New York City, so does the weekend walking tour. An urban institution by now, the tour may have its walkers staring up at the schooners of the South Street Seaport or scrutinizing art at Harlem's Studio Museum. A group may take to the shores of Crotona Lake in the Bronx to study its aquatic insect life, or to Greenwood Cemetery in Brooklyn to survey its gravestones. Other tours may provide a compact history of an area, from Chelsea to Staten Island's Richmondtown Restoration, suggesting ways to look at the rest of the city as we walk through it at other times.

title: STEWART SHARES LEAD
description: Payne Stewart, the man in colorful plus fours who lost a sudden death playoff to Peter Jacobsen at the Colonial National Invitation last Sunday, said: ''I'd like to not finish second this week. But if it's between second and third, then I'll take second. Golfers just aren't ever satisfied until they win.''

title: DOW SLIDES BY 10.37 IN HEAVY TRADING
description: Stock prices plummeted yesterday in heavy trading touched off mainly by growing apprehension over the financial stability of some banks. The Dow Jones industrial average closed at its lowest level in more than 15 months.

title: NEW TEST GAUGES HEART RESILIENCY
description: Scientists at the University of Minnesota have developed a simple test to show how age, disease or drugs affect the resiliency of the human heart muscle.

title: GREEN SPOTS, ON AND OFF THE BEATEN PATH
description: SPRING enters its second phase this Memorial Day weekend. The big splashes of bloom are gone, and the flower colors are more subtle. Many perennials - peonies, irises and columbines - are banked against the reds, pinks and oranges of azaleas. Dogwoods linger in some places, and the horse chestnuts join in.

title: PARTY'S DELEGATE VOTE IS ASSAILIED AS UNDEMOCRATIC
description: If we let the average voter into this room, they'd laugh at us and vote Republican,'' Eugene R. McKenna of the Bronx said yesterday.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY;
description: Course for the Archbishop

title: Moyers Still Unsigned
description: Steve Moyers, whose signing of a new, lower-paying contract with the Cosmos had appeared imminent, remained unsigned today and will not accompany the team Friday to Tampa, Fla., for the game Saturday night against the Tampa Bay Rowdies. Moyers reiterated that he had agreed to the contract, but added that there remained a minor detail that he refused to disclose.

title: OLMEDO SEAT ON COUNCIL FILLED
description: The City Council chose Nydia M. Velazquez yesterday to fill the Brooklyn Council seat left vacant by the conviction of Luis A. Olmedo on corruption charges.

title: ESMARK INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Includes extraordinary gains of $3,000,000 for the quarter and $4,462,000 for the 6 months, and an extraordinary gain of $15,374,000 for the 6 months from Esmark's issuance of 2,597,320 common shares in a stock- for-debt swap in exchange for $117,900,000 of its promissory notes. Share earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split on Dec. 1, 1983, effected as a 100 percent stock dividend.

title: SALVADORAN ARMY SHIFTS 2 RIGHTISTS
description: Two influential rightist military officers have been transferred to posts outside El Salvador, a spokesman for the high command said today.

title: 2 BANKS ARE REPORTED INTERESTED IN CONTINENTAL
description: Of the banks that have expressed interest in acquiring Continental Illinois, only Citicorp and First National of Chicago are still seriously considering a purchase, banking sources said today.

title: CONCHEMCO INC reports earnings for Qtr to April 28
description: b-After a loss from discontinued operations of $15,000 for the quarter and a gain from discontinued operations of $369,000,000 for the 6 months. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $7,000 for the quarter and $284,000 for the 6 months.

title: Nobel Prize Group Asks Soviet to Free Sakharovs
description: The Norwegian Nobel Committee, which awards the Nobel Peace Prize, sent a letter today to Konstantin U. Chernenko, the Soviet leader, asking him to allow Andrei D. Sakharov and his wife, Yelena G. Bonner, to leave the Soviet Union if they wish.

title: MILITARY AID BILL FOR EL SALVADOR PASSED BY HOUSE
description: The House of Representatives approved $61.75 million in emergency military aid for El Salvador today but voted against further financing for Nicaraguan rebels.

title: RICH HONEYCUTT IS SHARP AGAIN
description: When Rick Honeycutt joined the Los Angeles Dodgers last August, he found a box in his locker containing an assortment of nails, tacks and sandpaper, just in case he ever felt like doctoring up baseballs again.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: Story of a Drifter In New York Slums

title: OSHMAN'S SPORTING GOODS INC reports earnings for Qtr to April 28
description: b-After an after-tax LIFO charge of $127,000. c-Net loss after an after-tax LIFO charge of $111,000.

title: CHARTER CO reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net income includes a credit of $5,500,000 from an accounting adjustment. There were no share earnings for the year-ago quarter after a provision for preferred dividends.

title: 'MASQUERADE' SEQUEL: THE TITLE IS THE PUZZLE
description: Britain began its quest today for Kit Williams's newest treasure.

title: ESTIMATE BOARD PASSES REZONING OF THE WEST SIDE
description: A rezoning plan to preserve the character of the Upper West Side won the unanimous approval last night of the Board of Estimate even though it was criticized for having too many ''loopholes'' to achieve its purpose.

title: GNC ENERGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to April 28
REVELSTOKE COMPANIES LTD reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
THE END OF ARMS CONTROL
description: Grinning and joking in his best aw- shucks manner, President Reagan told the nation the other night that if he were ''concerned'' about additional missile-bearing Soviet submarines being stationed off U.S. coasts, ''I wouldn't be sleeping in this house tonight.''

title: Leader Drops Out
description: Daley Thompson of Britain passed up the final event after building a big lead in a decathlon today, enabling Dave Steen of Canada to win the competition at U.C.L.A. Thompson, the 1983 world champion, had won all nine events when he decided not to run the 1,500 meters, reportedly because he had no chance to break the world decathlon mark. At the time, he was leading Steen, 7,938-7,567. Steen went on to win with 8,242 points.

title: WYLE LABORATORIES reports earnings for Qtr to April 30
FRIDAY, MAY 25, 1984 International
description: New attacks on Persian Gulf shipping were announced by Iraq and Iran. Iraq said its planes had attacked two ''naval targets'' leaving Kharg Island, Iran's main oil terminal in the gulf. Hours later, Iran said its planes had retaliated by attacking an oil tanker off the coast of Saudi Arabia. (Page A1, Columns 5-6.)

title: STAGE: 'THE WIZ' BACK ON BROADWAY
description: YOU may well wonder why anyone would bother to revive ''The Wiz'' on Broadway only nine years after the original production - and only a few weeks after the film version last aired on network television. The answer, heaven knows, is not to be found in anything that happens on stage in the tacky touring production now parked at the Lunt-Fontanne. The real explanation, I suspect, has to do with the fact that school is out.

title: KELLY-JOHNSTON ENTERPRISES INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Includes an extraordinary gain of $62,602 from the extinguishment of convertible debentures.

title: Japan Vehicle Output
description: Japan's auto makers produced 953,345 cars, trucks and buses in April, up 1.6 percent from a year earlier, the Japan Automobile Manufacturers Association said today. Separately, the Japan Iron and Steel Federation said the nation's steel exports fell to 2.7 million tons in April, down two-tenths of 1 percent from April 1983 and down 15.7 percent from March.

title: FINANCE/NEW ISSUES ; Texas Authority Bonds Yield Maximum 11 3/8%
description: A $265 million offering of the Lower Colorado River Authority of Texas is being offered with a maximum yield of 11 3/8 percent for bonds due in 2013 through underwriters led by First Boston Corporation.

title: POLISH AND JEWISH AMERICANS' JOINT TASK
description: To the Editor:

title: 5 SALVADORANS ARE FOUND GUILTY IN SLAYING OF U.S. CHURCHWOMEN
description: Five former members of El Salvador's national guard were convicted of aggravated homicide today in the 1980 deaths of four United States churchwomen.

title: Why Mr. Spock may soon take turn for better.
description: ''I'M calling it death, dead, finished - he's in the box!'' said Leonard Nimoy about Mr. Spock, the much-beloved Vulcan he plays in the Star Trek series. Mr. Nimoy confirmed that Spock did indeed die at the end of ''Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan.'' And he added that it would be ''a nasty cheat'' if that ending turned out to be a trick and if the character were easily resurrected. So does that mean that Spock is gone for all time? Or that Mr. Nimoy will not appear in the coming ''Star Trek'' sequel, which opens next Friday?

title: HOW TO MAKE HISTORY WITH A LOT OF MODESTY
description: Carol E. Dinkins says she never thought of herself as a woman lawyer. She has always ''proved'' herself, she says, ''as a lawyer, not a woman lawyer.''

title: Alternate to Race at Indy
description: Chris Kneifel today became the first

title: People
description: Norman F. Bierman joins Compton Advertising as an executive vice president and director.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of an editing error, an article in some copies of Sports Pages yesterday about drug dependency in major league baseball misidentified Barry Rona. He is counsel to the Player Relations Committee.

title: ;  Hamilton Signs Pact
description: Scott Hamilton , the Olympic gold medalist, has signed a multiyear contract with Ice Capades and will join the tour as a skater in August, according to the Ice Capades president, Richard Palmer .

title: A GROWING CASE OF MARKET JITTERS
description: No one knows its origins, where it will lead or how to deal with it. But the financial markets have been hit by a serious case of the jitters.

title: WARDS CO reports earnings for Year to Feb 29
Banks Will Reimburse Texas Robbery Victims
description: Two banks have changed their policies, saying they will reimburse customers who are forced at gunpoint to make withdrawals from automatic teller machines.

title: PANTRY PRIDE INC reports earnings for Qtr to May 5
description: b-Includes income from discontinued operations of $128,000 for the quarter and $765,000 for the 9 months, tax credits of $1,482,000 for the quarter and $3,628,000 for the 9 months, and a Chapter 11 debt reduction of $1,150,000 for the 6 months. c-After income from discontinued operations of $110,000 for the quarter and a loss from discontinued operations of $100,000 for the 9 months, tax credits of $2,560,000 for the quarter and $5,360,000 for the 9 months, and a Chapter 11 debt reduction of $1,300,000 for the 9 months.

title: U.S. FEARS STEP-UP; TANKERS SET AFIRE
description: New attacks on Persian Gulf shipping, the first in six days, were announced today by both Iraq and Iran.

title: IF HE SAYS IT'S BROCCOLI, IT'S BROCCOLI
description: Seventeen years ago when Eugene A. Rosengarden was a 26-year-old lawyer just hired by the United States Customs Service, he was sent off to Brussels to observe the workings of the Nomenclature Committee of the Customs Cooperation Council.

title: AROUND THE NATION California Woman, 71, Strangles Her Husband
description: A 71-year-old woman described as a ''sweet little old thing'' faces up to 11 years in prison for strangling her 92- year-old ailing husband with a nylon stocking.

title: TOTAL ASSETS PROTECTION INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-After a tax credit equal to 3 cents a share.

title: No Headline
description: CuomoWantsIndustry To Pay Cleanup Taxes

title: BURLINGTON COAT FACTORY reports earnings for Qtr to April 30

BASEBALL ; ; A's Beat Orioles, Then Drop Boros OAKLAND, Calif., May 24 (AP) - The Oakland A's defeated the Baltimore Orioles, 3-2, today even though they committed two errors and collected only six hits. But the victory did not save the job of Manager Steve Boros, who was dismissed less than an hour later.
description: Jackie Moore, the A's first-base coach, was named by the club's president, Roy Eisenhardt, as the new manager. The pitching coach, Ron Schueler, also was dismissed. Eisenhardt said Boros and Schueler both were offered other jobs in the organization.

title: ' 'Night Mother' Closing
description: '' 'Night Mother,'' Marsha Norman's 1983 Pulitzer Prize-winning play, starring Kathy Bates and Anne Pitoniak, will close June 3 at the Westside Arts Theater after 54 performances. The play opened on Broadway March 31, 1983, at the Golden Theater and played 380 performances. The original New York production will be performed June 29 through July 1 at the Spoleto Festival in Italy.

title: ALTEX RESOURCES reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Northwest Air President Will Add Chief's Title
description: Steven G. Rothmeier, the 37-year- old president of Northwest Airlines, will take on the additional post of chief executive next November, M. J. Lapensky, chairman and chief executive of the airline, announced.

title: U.S.-SOVIET TRADE BARS SAID TO COST $10 BILLION
description: American companies are losing at least $10 billion a year in sales to the Soviet Union because of United States Government restrictions, C. William Verity Jr., the chairman of the executive committee of Armco Inc., said yesterday.

title: Bush Praises Reagan On Minority-Group Aid
description: Vice President Bush said Wednesday that the Reagan Administration, through new jobs created by the economic recovery, had done a better job helping minorities than most people thought.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE ; 2 Visa Companies
description: Get a New Chief

title: VARIETY OF CELEBRATIONS FOR THE HUDSON VALLEY
description: Villages and towns across the Hudson Valley will be celebrating Memorial Day this weekend with traditional parades, ceremonies and speeches. In addition, many communities have arranged a wide variety of events, ranging from antique shows to sheep-sheering demonstrations to train, trolley and boat rides.

title: TELTONE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
KOCH ASKS AIRPORT STRIP-SEARCHES FOR DRUGS
description: Mayor Koch proposed today that Army personnel be used at borders and airports to conduct body searches of people entering the country as a way of curbing the flow of drugs into the country.

title: Dining Out Guide: Health Foods
description: Following is a summary of reviews of restaurants that have appeared in The New York Times. Stars are followed by the date of original publication. Prices are current, and only weekend hours are given. EAST WEST, 2160 Broadway, at 76th

title: Denmark Expels Two In Soviet Group as Spies
description: Denmark expelled two members of the staff of a Soviet trade delegation today after charging they were involved in espionage.

title: U.S. FEARS STEP-UP; IRAN IS REPORTED WEIGHING PLANS TO WIDEN WAR
description: Reagan Administration officials have reportedly told members of Congress that some intelligence analysts believe Iran may be planning to widen the Persian gulf war by attacking Saudi Arabian oilfields and sending suicide planes against oil tankers.

title: ;  Accord Defended On Agent Orange
description: Lawyers who negotiated a $180 million settlement on behalf of Vietnam War veterans in the Agent Orange case defended the May 7 agreement against charges of a ''sellout'' by some veterans and their wives yesterday in Federal District Court in Brooklyn.

title: No Headline
description: Governor Cuomo was the guest on a statewide radio call-in program last night, and the first caller was Mayor Koch, who endorsed the Governor's campaign to raise the state's legal drinking age from 19 to 21.

title: STEEL QUOTAS: THE DISPUTE
description: EVEN though the nation's steelmakers will break even this quarter - after more than two years of red ink - the mood of the 500 executives at the industry's convention in New York City this week was anything but celebratory. They seemed strangely subdued, still somewhat in shock from the severity of their industry's problems.

title: Woodward Plan
description: A group of Woodward & Lothrop Inc. shareholders, skeptical about the proposed $220 million takeover of the Washington-based department store chain by A. Alfred Taubman, told the Securities and Exchange Commission that they are seeking other proposals for the acquisition of Woodward & Lothrop shares. The group, which owns 559,456 common shares, or 14.96 percent of the shares outstanding, said it would ''evaluate'' the Taubman offer of $59 a share in cash, but is also considering suing the Michigan real estate investor.

title: UNITED STATES SHOE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to April 28
;  Flyers Choose a Coach
description: The Philadelphia Flyers, looking for new direction after three consecutive failures in the first round of the Stanley Cup playoffs, have named Mike Keenan , a former University of Toronto coach, as their new head coach. Bobby Clarke , the Flyers' general manager, said Keenan, who is 34 years old, had signed a multiyear contract, but the length and terms of the pact were not disclosed. Keenan led Toronto to the Canadian Collegiate championship last season.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: FRIDAY, MAY 25, 1984

title: Libya Is Said to Arrest 3 More Britons
description: Libya arrested three more Britons between May 13 and May 15 and is holding them incommunicado with two who were arrested on April 17, the British Government said today.

title: CONGRESS VOTES RISE IN NATIONAL DEBT
description: Congress today approved a $30 billion increase in the ceiling on the national debt, barely beating the Treasury's midnight deadline.

title: NEW YORK UNIVERSITY; 'WAIT OUT THE SOVIET UNION'
description: The United States ''should be less obsessed with the Soviets,'' because ''the Soviet idea is spent - history is moving away from it with astounding speed,'' Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan said yesterday.

title: EXHIBITION HALL OPENS WITH A FLOURISH
description: Referring to the New York Public Library yesterday as ''possibly our most precious intellectual treasure in a city rich in intellectual treasures,'' Mayor Koch at 9 A.M. ceremoniously opened the carved bronze doors of the library's new Gottesman Hall, which has been closed to the public for more than 40 years.

title: UNESCO PICKS PANEL TO SUGGEST CHANGES IN AGENCY
description: Unesco's 51-nation executive board appointed a special committee today to draft proposals for changes in how the agency functions. The move came in the aftermath of the United States announcement that it will withdraw unless the organization curbs what the Reagan Administration regards as politically objectionable activities.

title: THE BIG BOARD'S NEW LEADER
description: John J. Phelan Jr., born and bred a stock exchange specialist, Wall Street's quintessential inside man, moved onto center stage yesterday as he officially took over as chairman and chief executive of the New York Stock Exchange. A second-generation trader, he had been the No. 2 man for four years and succeeds William Milfred Batten.

title: ORION RESEARCH INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Esmark Accepts New Beatrice Bid
description: The Beatrice Foods Company agreed yesterday to buy Esmark Inc. for $60 a share - or $2.8 billion - creating the second-biggest food and consumer products company in the world after the British-Dutch Unilever organization.

title: Top Officer Elected At New York Merc
description: Rosemary T. McFadden has been elected president of the New York Mercantile Exchange.

title: No Headline
description: TruckPackedWithArt Is Stolen in Manhattan

title: FOR RELATIVES OF THE 4 CHURCHWOMEN, IT'S ONLY A 'FIRST STEP'
description: Relatives of the four American churchwomen slain in El Salvador in 1980 said yesterday that the conviction of five former national guardsmen was a positive step toward justice, but added that questions about complicity and a cover-up in the slayings remained.

title: U.S. COURT RULES ON INSANITY PLEA
description: A Federal appeals court issued guidelines yesterday for insanity defenses, ruling that evidence of insanity must be based on a theory that had ''substantial acceptance'' in the mental health profession.

title: SAINTS REPORTEDLY UP FOR SALE
description: John Mecom Jr., the majority owner of the New Orleans Saints, has told a member of the National Football League's financial committee that he might sell all or part of his team, a prominent league owner said today.

title: MUTUAL COLD SHOULDERS IN EAST-WEST RELATIONS
description: To the Editor:

title: THE REGION ; ;  Newsboy's Killer Gets 41 Years
description: Calling his acts ''cruel, sadistic, bestial and unpardonable,'' a judge sentenced Robert Golliver today to the maximum term of 41Z years to life in prison for the murder of a newsboy.

title: LATIN PLAN ON DEBTS REPORTED
description: The governments of four heavily indebted Latin American countries are discussing a proposal to extend repayment of their foreign debts over 15 years, according to reports here and in Bogota, Colombia.

title: WORRIES ON BANKS JAR MARKETS
description: Renewed concern over the stability of the nation's banking system - this time touched off by unfounded rumors about the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company - shook financial markets yesterday as investors dumped stocks, shunned banks' certificates of deposit and shifted their money into the safety of United States Government securities.

title: SCOUTING;
description: Lietzke's Focus Not on the Open

title: NEW YORK TELEPHONE CO reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Comparable year-ago results were not given, the company said, because it is a newly restructured entity with new modes of operation and new tariff structures for which comparable historical financial statements do not exist. New York Telephone is a subsidiary of the Nynex Corp.

title: HARRIS STEEL GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Includes a gain of $1,810 from discontinued operations. c-After a loss of $151,239 from discontinued operations.

title: ENVIRONMENTAL TECTONICS CORP reports earnings for Year to Feb 29
description: The company said share earnings reflect a 50 percent stock dividend to be paid June 15.

title: THEATER: THE STORY OF JONESTOWN, IN PROVIDENCE
description: James Reston Jr.'s knowledge of the nightmare of Jonestown - the suicide and murder of 913 people at the direction of the Rev. Jim Jones - is authoritative. His findings were recorded in a National Public Radio documentary and in his book, ''Our Father Who Art in Hell,'' the harrowing story of both the Guyana tragedy and of the author's own attempt to understand the incomprehensible.

title: BROAD EDUCATION ADVOCATED
description: Lieut. Gov. Alfred B. DelBello, speaking at the bicentennial convocation of the State Board of Regents and the State University, said today that ''the world changes too quickly for us to prepare our young people narrowly in anticipation of a particular job.''

title: ARISTEK COMMUNITIES reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: All year-ago figures include a gain of $436,000 from the sale of real estate.

title: THE BREVITY OF WIT
description: During the two years since I gave up teaching law to become a university president, I have reflected more than once upon the rhetorical dimensions of the academic enterprise I left and of the one that I have taken up.

title: TELECI INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net income.

title: BROWN GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to April 28
description: Share earnings and shares outstanding reflect a 2-for-1 stock split effected in the form of a stock dividend declared on June 2, 1983.

title: 2 Investors Buy Part of Pullman
description: The Pullman Transportation Company said two Lebanese investors, Toufic Aboukhater and Said Khoury, had bought a ''significant'' equity position that reduces the Signal Companies' interest to under 60 percent.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''To wage war against drugs we need an army to win.

title: Virginia Woman Held In Her Daughter's Death
description: A woman was charged today with murder in the stabbing death of her 6-year- old daughter, one of two children whose bodies were found after a house fire, the authorities said.

title: World Bank Aid Plan
description: The governing board of the World Bank approved plans today to raise $9 billion for aid to the poorest nations, as well as plans for an $8.4 billion capital increase. The action had been expected, and the bank's 21 executive directors recommended that its more than 140 member nations approve both increases.

title: HARRY S. BURKE
description: Harry S. Burke, who served in Connecticut's General Assembly for 20 years, died Wednesday at his home in East Hartford. He was 87 years old.

title: JACO ELECTRONICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: LOWE'S COMPANIES reports earnings for Qtr to April 30
MOLSON COMPANIES reports earnings for Year to March 31
description: b-After a write-off of $17,600,000 on compact beer bottles. c-After a loss of $1,500,000 from discontinued operations and an extraordinary charge of $1,500,000. Share earnings were not immediately available. The company is listed on the Toronto and Montreal stock exchanges.

title: ZURN INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Includes a gain of $1,695,000, or 30 cents a share, from the reversal of loss provisions for contract claims which were settled. c-Includes a charge of $3 million as a result of a provision for plant consolidation costs.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY;
description: A Reunion and a Protest

title: THE FINAL EPISODES OF 'NANCY ASTOR'
description: AS the eight-part Masterpiece Theater presentation of ''Nancy Astor'' heads into its final episodes, the heroine continues to remain oddly unsympathetic, but the series itself gets considerably more interesting. Trimmed a bit for American audiences, the BBC production, which can be seen Sundays at 9 P.M. on Channel 13, has now reached the 1930's in the biography of Nancy Langhorn, the Virginia belle who, after a disastrous first marriage, went on to become Lady Astor and a member of Britain's House of Commons.

title: G.O.P. Is Told Its Ads Count Against Ceiling
description: A divided Federal Election Commission told the Republican National Committee today that a national television advertising campaign against the Democratic Presidential candidates would count against its $6.9 million spending limit for the national election.

title: Pope Assails Pornography
description: Pope John Paul II denounced what he called an increase in pornography today and warned against sex in movies.

title: American Maize
description: Sol Goldman, a New York real estate investor, has increased his stake in the American Maize-Products Company, the food products and real estate concern, to 613,642 class A common shares, or 16.2 percent of the shares outstanding, according to a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Mr. Goldman said he made the purchases for investment purposes.

title: PUBLISHING: BOOKSELLERS' CONVENTION
description: THE eyes of the book world will be on Washington for four days starting tomorrow as some 19,000 booksellers, publishers, authors, agents and editors descend on the nation's capital for the 84th annual convention of the American Booksellers Association.

title: Tigers Tie Road Mark
description: Jack Morris overpowered the California Angels, 5-1, with a four-hitter and 10 strikeouts tonight as the Detroit Tigers tied the major league record with their 17th straight road victory.

title: OIL-DRI CORP OF AMERICA reports earnings for Qtr to April 30
WITNESS AGAINST DELOREAN TELLS OF 'MORAL' DEBT
description: James Timothy Hoffman, a key witness in the drug case against John Z. DeLorean, testified today that he continued as a Government informer after he had fulfilled his obligation to the Government in May 1982 because ''I felt I had a moral obligation.''

title: 4 Families in Coal Fire Town Accept Homes Buy-Out Offer
description: Four families have become the first to agree to sell their homes in a $42 million Federal buy-out plan for this coal town, which has been plagued by a 22- year-old underground mine fire.

title: COMP-U-CARD INTERNATIONAL reports earnings for Qtr to April 30
description: b-Includes an extraordinary credit of $29,000. c-Net loss.

title: ;  Ticket Complaints
description: The Detroit Tigers' fast start has triggered a rush to the club's box office, but Attorney General Frank Kelley of Michigan wants to find out whether the choicest seats are being peddled illegally. Mr. Kelley has notified the American League club that his office is investigating complaints from fans unable to buy box seats to games in Tiger Stadium. Frederick Hoffecker , chief of the Attorney General's Consumer Protection and Charitable Trusts Division, said the state decided to look into the complaints after a group of Attorney General's office employees tried unsuccessfully in April to purchase box seats for a July doubleheader.

title: Bankruptcy System Reprieve
description: A bill that would permit continued operation of the nation's bankruptcy court system through June 20 was passed by the Senate in a voice vote today.

title: Key Rates
description: * Kenny Index, Kenny Information Systems Salomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: FRIDAY SPORTS Baseball
description: Mets vs. Los Angeles Dodgers, at Shea Stadium, 8:05 P.M. With the rotation moved back because of the rainout of the Wednesday night's game against the Giants, Dwight Gooden gets the start tonight.

title: BEELINE INC reports earnings for Qtr to April 21
WEST CHEMICAL PRODUCTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 25
description: b-After an extraordinary gain of $139,120. c-After a gain from discontinued operations of $27,550 and an extraordinary credit of $14,200. The year-ago quarter results were restated for the sale of a subsidiary.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Friday MUSICIANS, AGED 4 TO 16

title: Sir Stanley Hooker, 76; Designed Harrier's Jet
description: Sir Stanley Hooker, an aircraft engine designer who oversaw development of the engine for the Harrier jets used in the Falkland war and had a part in developing the World War II Spitfire, died today after a long illness. He was 76 years old.

title: CITY COLLEGE; SCIENTIFIC LITERACY IS STRESSED
description: Graduates at City College were urged yesterday to be ''scientifically literate'' as they begin postgraduate work or enter the job market.

title: Manatt Hails Absence Of Anderson in '84 Race
description: Charles T. Manatt, the Democratic national chairman, said today that John B. Anderson's decision against entering the 1984 Presidential race was the biggest political development so far this year and would be ''a net plus of four million votes'' for the Democratic nominee.

title: KROY INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
E.F. Hutton Adjustable Notes
description: The E.F. Hutton Group said it is offering $100 million of floating-rate notes due in 1994 at a price of 99.

title: CYBERMEDIC INC reports earnings for Qtr to April 30
SCOUTING ; BEYOND A GAME
description: Jeff Durgan, the defender who has been embroiled recently in contract problems with the Cosmos, is looking forward to Wednesday night, when he will be one of 19 players for Team America in a match against Italy, the defending World Cup champions, at Giants Stadium.

title: Money Fund Assets Rise For 3d Week
description: Assets of the nation's money market mutual funds continued to grow in the week ended Wednesday, rising $1.7 billion, to $175.04 billion, the Investment Company reported yesterday.

title: THREADGILL'S SEXTET OFFERS NEW JAZZ AT SWEET BASIL
description: WHEN the Henry Threadgill Sextet pulled into Sweet Basil this week, it had something few modern jazz groups can boast of - 3 months' and 20 cities' worth of on-the- road experience that Mr. Threadgill calls, with tongue barely in cheek, ''the great North American Tour.'' In places such as Erie, Pa., Shaker Heights, Ohio, and Santa Fe, N.M., the band has been playing up-to-the- minute jazz for people who rarely get to hear it - people who have been virtually written off as jazz listeners.

title: ISRAEL SAYS ITS PLANES RAIDED PALESTINIANS IN THE BAKAA REGION
description: Israeli planes attacked a Palestinian guerrilla base in the Syrian-controlled Bekaa region today, the Israeli military command in Tel Aviv reported. It was the second Israeli air raid on eastern Lebanon this week.

title: Boesky Increases Fishbach Stake
description: Ivan F. Boesky, the Wall Street investor, and companies affiliated with him, have increased their stake in the Fishbach Corporation, an electronics and mechanics contractor, to 355,798 common shares, or 9.3 percent of 3,817,569 shares outstanding, according to a Securities and Exchange Commission filing. Mr. Boesky said the purchases had been made for investment purposes.

title: EYE UPON JUNE 5TH, MONDALE MAKES 2 CAMAPIGN STOPS IN NEW MEXICO
description: Under the mesquite and cottonwood trees of downtown Santa Fe, two doctors watched this afternoon as Walter F. Mondale denounced the Reagan Administration's policies.

title: HART LEADING IDAHO CAUCUSES
description: Senator Gary Hart, after winning a non- binding preference vote two days earlier, held a strong lead today as Idaho began the caucus process to chose delegates to the Democratic National Convention.

title: ECKERD, JACK CORP reports earnings for Qtr to April 28
THE REGION ; ;  Hartford Faulted In Bridge Collapse
description: State officials responsible for the Mianus River bridge did not distribute Federal regulatory guidelines that might have made inspectors aware of problems that led to the collapse of the bridge last summer, Federal officials said in a report this week.

title: Drug Used for Hypertension May Impair Breathing Ability
description: A drug widely used for treatment of hypertension and coronary artery disease may further reduce breathing ability in patients with emphysema or chronic bronchitis, physicians were told Thursday.

title: Astrotech Plan
description: The Astrotech International Corporation said it would form a subsidiary to enter the space transportation business that would require institutional debt financing of $500 million to $1 billion, with subsequent offerings of common stock as required. Astrotech also said it was in discussions with the National Aeronautics and Space Administration regarding the acquisiion of the fifth space shuttle and additional shuttle orbiters.

title: LEADER OF STRIKING BRITISH MINERS OPTIMISTIC ABOUT OPENING TALKS
description: The National Union of Mineworkers and the National Coal Board, locked in a dispute that has closed most of the nation's coal mines for nearly three months, moved toward negotiations today for the first time in weeks.

title: SUPER SKY INTERNATIONAL reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
PAGURIAN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
;  Sampson Is Top Rookie
description: Ralph Sampson , who led the Houston Rockets in scoring, rebounding and blocked shots, was named unanimously yesterday as the National Basketball Association's rookie of the year. The 7-foot-4-inch Sampson, the top pick in last year's college draft, drew all 76 votes cast by a panel of sportswriters and broadcasters. He led all rookies with an average of 21 points a game, ranked fifth in the league with an average of 11.1 rebounds and was third in blocked shots with 2.4 a game.

title: AMERICAN REALTY TRUST reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net income.

title: Danish Prices Up 0.3%
description: Price increases for medicine, medical services and foodstuffs led a three-tenths of 1 percent rise in Danish consumer prices in April, pushing the rise over 12 months to 6.6 percent, the Government's Bureau of Statistics said today. In another report, the bureau said Denmark's trade deficit widened in April to a billion kroner, or about $100 million, up from deficits of 571 million kroner in March and 204 million kroner in April 1983.

title: SCREEN: 'HEAT OF DESIRE,' AN AFFAIR
description: A TIMID academic is caught up in a reckless erotic escapade in ''Heat of Desire,'' the latest of several thinking-man's sex films to have opened here in the last few weeks. It begins, most improbably, when the pouty mistress (Clio Goldsmith) of a politician announces that she is bored with her lot and determines to have a fling with the very next man she sees. He turns out to be a pale, nervous professor of philosophy, played by Patrick Dewaere, who looks terribly gaunt here and committed suicide after completing the role.

title: DUCKWALL-ALCO STORES INC reports earnings for Qtr to April 29
D. H. HOLMES CO., LTD reports earnings for Qtr to April 28
Compensation In Gems Case
description: A $6.7 million fund will be set up to provide redress to customers of the International Diamond Corporation, formerly the nation's largest investment diamond company, the Federal Trade Commission said today. Establishment of the fund is part of a settlement of an F.T.C. complaint charging the diamond company with falsely contending that gems it sold were a risk-free investment and that its prices were lower than normal retail.

title: Utility Misses Plant Payment
description: For the second consecutive month, the Public Service Company of New Hampshire has missed a $1 million construction payment for the Millstone 3 nuclear power plant. Public Service owns 2.8 percent of the $3.54 billion plant now under construction in Waterford, Conn.

title: METS AGAIN LOSE BY RUN
description: In the early part of this season, the Mets specialized in comeback victories. But lately they have discovered that it is easier to get ahead and stay ahead.

title: ART: SMALL MET SHOW HIGHLIGHTS ACQUISITIONS
description: IF you want to see some great art

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: THE NIGHTMARE YEARS: 1930-40. Volume II of 20th Century Journey: A Memoir of a Life and the Times. By William L. Shirer. Illustrated. 654 pages. Little, Brown. $22.50.

title: op-ed
description: op

title: ;  Angels Sign Swan
description: The California Angels have signed Craig Swan , the former Met right- hander. Swan, 33, had a 1-0 record with an 8.20 earned runs average in 10 games with the Mets before he was let go earlier this month. Swan, who is 59-71 lifetime, threw last Friday and Sunday in Yankee Stadium and impressed the Angels, who made up their mind after watching him again Wednesday.

title: RENT-A-CENTER INC reports earnings for Qtr to April 30
description: Year-ago results are restated to reflect the acquisition on Nov. 28, 1983 of interests in 22 limited partnerships.

title: HART, IN JERSEY, STRESSES RECORD ON ENVIRONMENT
description: Senator Gary Hart today abandoned his resolve to stay out of fights with Walter F. Mondale, accusing the former Vice President of practicing ''juvenile'' politics.

title: WHERE BONN STANDS 35 YEARS AFTERWARD
description: The Basic Law of the Federal Republic of Germany, adopted 35 years ago this week, signified the end of military occupation after World War II and provided the legal framework for the West German state. On the anniversary, it is appropriate to review the development of the republic and to consider where West Germany stands today.

title: THE REGION ; ;  Special GrandJury For Fire at Park
description: An Ocean County Superior Court judge today ordered a special grand jury empaneled to decide if criminal charges should be filed in an amusement park fire that killed eight youths, an official said.

title: JUDGE DISMISSES SUIT TO OUST CHICAGO MAYOR
description: A judge dismissed a suit against Mayor Harold Washington today in which a political rival sought to remove the Mayor from office because he failed to file an ethics statement on time.

title: Killer in Landmark Case Gets 2d Death Sentence
description: Charles Proffitt, whose initial death sentence prompted the Supreme Court to reinstate capital punishment in 1976, today was sentenced again to die in Florida's electric chair.

title: Midwestern Filing
description: The Midwestern Companies, a holding company with energy interests, said that it had filed for protection under Chapter 11 of the Federal Bankruptcy Code. Gene W. Beckman, president, said the filing represents the company's continuing effort to restructure. The company, which earlier this year appointed a new management team, cited cash-flow problems.

title: 'OLD SAM'
description: Sam Snead, who will be 72 years old Sunday, was honored Wednesday as the year's inductee into the Memorial shrine at Jack Nicklaus's Muirfield Village Golf Club prior to the annual Memorial Tournament. Snead, who won a record 85 tournaments on the PGA Tour, joined such former golfing stars as Bobby Jones, Walter Hagen and Francis Ouimet in the shrine.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY;
description: Farewell Performance

title: CROWNX INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: The company net was equal to 14 cents a share versus 6 cents a share on class A shares.

title: EDITORS' NOTE
description: Under this heading, The Times amplifies articles or rectifies what the editors consider significant lapses of fairness, balance or perspective.

title: YANKEES' NIEKRO DEFEATS MARINERS
description: With their hitters still struggling with their non- production at the plate, Yankee pitchers have now imposed the same struggle on the opponent, not yielding a run in the last 19 innings.

title: 2 LOUIS XIII PISTOLS STOLEN IN VIENNA
description: A pair of early 17th-century French wheellock pistols, once owned by King Louis XIII of France, have been stolen from the Waffensammlung, the armory of the Kunsthistorisches Museum in Vienna. It is the second theft within the last 18 months of a pair of pistols from that period belonging to the armory.

title: INSIDE AND OUT, LIBRARY RECAPTURES ITS SPLENDOR
description: AnAppraisal

title: AN ART DECO WAREHOUSE BECOMES A CONDOMINIUM
description: For nearly 50 years, before the development of the Lincoln Center area of Manhattan, the facade of the Sofia Brothers warehouse at Columbus Avenue and West 61st Street - despite the building's utilitarian purpose - reflected the self-conscious sense of elegance that characterized some of the West Side's best-known apartment buildings.

title: SCREEN: 'COLD FEET,' 2 COUPLES BREAKKING UP
description: AT the beginning of Bruce vanDusen's ''Cold Feet,'' which means to be a hip romantic comedy, two young, upwardly aspiring Manhattan couples are breaking up.

title: EXCHANGE APPOINTS ELLINGHAUS
description: William M. Ellinghaus, former president of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, was named executive vice chairman of the New York Stock Exchange yesterday. The exchange also re-elected two vice chairmen, Roger E. Birk and Michael Creem.

title: ; WE CAN BET ON THE COURTHOUSE RENOVATION
description: To the Editor:

title: Miss Hall Leads By Shot After 68
description: Debbie Hall posted an eagle, three birdies and a bogey today for a 68 and a one-stroke lead over Pat Meyers in the first round of the $150,000 Corning Classic.

title: Military Contracts
description: The McDonnell Douglas Corporation won a total of $227.9 million in seven Navy contracts, all for support of F-18 aircraft, the Defense Department said. The department also said General Dynamics won $107.9 million from the Navy for ship missile production.

title: MONDALE CHALLENGES FOES TO DEBATE HIM INDIVIDUALLY IN JERSEY
description: Former Vice President Walter F. Mondale said today that if a three-way debate with the Rev. Jesse Jackson and Senator Gary Hart over New Jersey television could not be arranged, he wanted to debate his rivals individually.

title: JACKSON OFFERS PLAN TO IMPROVE PUBLIC EDUCATION
description: The Rev. Jesse Jackson, pressing for votes in the New Jersey Democratic Presidential primary, today offered what he called ''basic prescriptions'' that a Jackson Administration would follow in improving public education.

title: TREASURY STATEMENT
description: reasury Statement Total Public Debt, April 31 $1,486,116 Interest on Public Debt, April 11,423 Interest, Fiscal Year through April 84,553 Actual Deficit, Fiscal 1983 195,354 Projected Deficit, Fiscal 1984 177,778 Projected Deficit, Fiscal 1985 178,976 Receipts, Fiscal Year through April 384,471 Receipts, Period Last Year 343,103 Outlays, Fiscal Year through April 490.752 Outlays, Period Last Year 475,630 Deficit, Fiscal Year through April 106,281 Deficit, Period Last Year 132,528 Gold at end of April 11,123

title: Kennedy Autopsy Says Death Was Accidental
description: An official autopsy report released today confirmed David A. Kennedy died of ''intoxication'' induced by cocaine and two prescription drugs and labeled the manner of death an ''accident.'' The report said there were two puncture wounds in the right groin that had been made shortly before Mr. Kennedy died.

title: SHORT-TERM BILL PRICES RISE
description: Short-term Treasury bill rates fell sharply yesterday, while yields of long-term bonds rose briefly to their highest levels of the year, and remain higher than anytime since July 1982.

title: PLESSEY CO PLO reports earnings for Qtr to March 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $3,947,000. c-After an extraordinary charge of $1,943,000. Share earnings are per American Depository Receipt.

title: 136 Are Dead as Floods Hit Bangladesh and North India
description: Floods in northeastern India and in Bangladesh were reported today to have left 136 people dead, hundreds of thousands homeless and crops devastated.

title: NORDSON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to April 29
description: b-After a loss of $2,082,000 from discontinued operations. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $368,000 for the quarter and $2,082,000 for the 6 months.

title: STANDARD LOGIC INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net income after extraordinary gains of $33,200 for the quarter and $126,200 for the 6 months.

title: B-52 Protest Case Brings Prayers
description: The Auxiliary Bishop of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Syracuse stood outside the Federal Courthouse here today and prayed for those involved in the case of seven defendants charged with damaging a B-52 bomber to protest the deployment of Cruise missiles.

title: CUBIST MASTERY OF JUAN GRIS
description: JUAN GRIS is the last of the great Cubists after Pablo Picasso, Georges Braque and Fernand Leger - to be given a major exhibition in the United States since 1980. Born in Spain in 1887, then a self-imposed exile in France at the age of 19, Gris was a special mixture of north and south, closed rooms and vibrant color, romantic temperament and classical taste. He is a minor master who produced works so stunning that it is a privilege to be around them.

title: State to Ask Permission To Feed Fasting Inmate
description: The state will seek a court order to force-feed a fasting prisoner, the New Hampshire Attorney General's office said today.

title: SOMEBODY IS LYING
description: William J. Casey, our Director of Central Intelligence, is thought to be deceptive by a couple of Congressional committee chairman. Has Mr. Casey, with credentials as a master spy, been doing some unauthorized lying?

title: THE REGION ; ;  Woman in Court Is Shot to Death
description: An East Lyme man shot and killed his estranged wife as their divorce proceedings began today in Superior Court here, the authorities said.

title: GREAT PACIFIC INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Includes an extraordinary gain of $8,270,000. c-The company changed its year- end to Dec. 31 from Oct. 31 and did not provide comparable year-ago results. The company is listed on the Toronto, Montreal, and Vancouver stock exchanges.

PHOENIX CANADA OIL CO LTD reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-After a writeoff of $2,508,198 of Peru exploration expenses and a foreign currency devaluation charge of $394,233. c-Net income which includes an exploration expenses writeoff of $344,490.

title: ISRAEL OPPOSES U.S. MISSILE SALE
description: Israel will oppose the Reagan Administration's plan to try again to sell Stinger antiaircraft missiles to Saudi Arabia, a spokesman for Prime Minister Yitzhak Shamir said tonight.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY;
description: Thoughts for 2083 At Brooklyn Bridge

title: RUMANIA DECIDES TO TAKE PART IN GAMES
description: Rumania, in a departure from Soviet-bloc policy, has decided to send a team to the Olympic Games in Los Angeles, a Rumanian official said here today after a meeting between international Olympic officials and Soviet-bloc sports leaders.

title: THE EVENING HOURS
description: ''I'M not crazy about nightclubs but

title: ;  Twins Offer Closer
description: A Minneapolis bank president, Carl Pohlad , will make an offer within days to buy controlling stock of the Minnesota Twins from the club president, Calvin Griffith , Pohlad said yesterrsday. Pohlad, president of the F.&M. Marquette Bank, has been negotiating with Griffith to buy 52 percent of the American League team's stock that Griffith owns with his sister, Thelma Haynes .

title: A NEW CHIEF IS DESIGNATED BY SOTHEBY'S
description: Michael L. Ainslie, president of the National Trust for Historic Preservation, will become president and chief executive officer of Sotheby's Holdings Inc. - the parent company of the international art-auction house - in July. The appointment of the 41-year- old Tennessee-born executive was announced yesterday by the London- based art-auction house, the world's oldest and largest.

title: TALCORP LTD reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Including a special gain of $508,000 from the sale of assets and tax credits and a writedown of U. S. oil and gas properties of $3,402,620. c-After a writedown of $824,060.

description: b-Comparable year-ago results are not available because the company did not go public until December 1983.

title: DOMINICANS HALT TALKS WITH I.M.F. OVER ITS DEMANDS
description: The Dominican Republic suspended negotiations with the International Monetary Fund on Thursday after rejecting demands that gasoline prices be raised 50 percent, Dominican officials said today.

title: GENTEX CORP reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net income.

title: SOLTI DROPS BAYREUTH ROLE
description: Sir Georg Solti, conductor of the controversial production of Wagner's ''Ring'' cycle unveiled last summer at the Bayreuth Festival, will not lead it this year. Citing his demanding schedule and medical advice, the 71-year-old conductor asked the festival's director, Wolfgang Wagner, to release him from his contract.

title: SCOUTING;
description: Downhill, Uphill

title: Where's Law Enforcement?
description: ''Where's the Mole?'' cry House Republicans as they ridicule the Democrats' continuing charges against the 1980 Reagan campaign staff. A 10-month investigation and 2,400-page majority report of the Human Resources Subcommittee finds a crime - the misuse of Government documents pilfered or leaked from the Carter White House - but no culprit.

title: WILSON, H J, CO reports earnings for Qtr to April 28
JEERS AND CHEERS GREET MONDALE AT NUCLEAR SITE
description: Walter F. Mondale, who has been criticized for his ties to organizaed labor, was booed and heckled by trade unionists today as he called for closing the Diablo Canyon nuclear power plant.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY;
description: The Word on Words

title: COUNCIL LEADERS URGE A PROGRAM TO DEVELOP JOBS
description: Senior City Council officials yesterday proposed a $10 million addition to next year's budget for youth employment programs.

title: FINDING CITY SUMMER RENTALS
description: This summer, Lynda Clarizio, a Harvard law student, plans to rent the Greenwich Village apartment of Martin Obler, a clinical psychologist, who will be in Southeast Asia. She found the sublet through the service her law firm, Debevoise & Plimpton, has for its summer associates.

title: BRITAIN'S MODERN 'RIGOLETTO' IN U.S. DEBUT AT HOUSTAN
description: Jonathan Miller's modernized version of Verdi's ''Rigoletto'' was given its American debut here Thursday night by the English National Opera. Houston greeted it with rave reviews and not a peep of protest.

title: C3 INC reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net income.

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: OPPOSITION PARTIES IN NICARAGUA OFFERED 12 WEEKS TO CAMPAIGN
description: The Sandinista Government announced Thursday night that it would allow opposition parties 12 weeks to wage the first national political campaign since the 1979 guerrilla takeover.

title: PURITY SUPREME
description: The Supermarkets General Corporation said it is holding discussions with Purity Supreme Inc. and expects to sign a definitive agreement soon on the acquisition of Purity Supreme, a New England-based chain of supermarkets, drugstores and warehouse stores. Supermarkets General operates 132 Pathmark supermarkets in the Northeast United States, 37 Rickel home improvement centers and 33 department stores. Purity has 28 supermarkets under the Purity Supreme name, 13 warehouse stores and 23 drugstores.

title: THE REGION ; ;  2A.M.BarClosing Urged in Rockland
description: The chairman of the Rockland County Legislature wants bars in the county to close at 2 A.M. instead of 4, to deter New Jersey youths from crossing the state line to take advantage of the later hours and the lower drinking age in New York.

title: THOR INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to April 30
description: b-Including income from discontinued operations of $530,848 for the quarter and $451,000 for the 9 months. Corrected from Wednesday, May 23.
